com.yantra.api.omp.payment

Interface triggerRequestCollection

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi

    public interface triggerRequestCollection

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document triggerRequestCollection(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The triggerRequestCollection() API marks orders as available to be picked up by payment time-triggered transactions after they have failed previously and were put on hold.

    • Method Detail

      • triggerRequestCollection

        org.w3c.dom.Document triggerRequestCollection(YFSEnvironment env,
                                              org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                       throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                              java.rmi.RemoteException
        The triggerRequestCollection() API marks orders as available to be picked up by payment time-triggered transactions after they have failed previously and were put on hold. Typically, these orders remain on hold until a user resolves the hold, and payment time-triggered transactions will not pick such held orders. When funds in a customer account increase, this API should be called so that these orders can be picked up by PAYMENT_COLLECTION agent again. This API processes orders that meet following conditions in increasing order of order total:
      • Orders that satisfy passed criteria.

      • Orders that need payment processing and are not yet AUTHORIZED and PAID
        • .
      • Customer account processing is internal
        Order has the hold configured for in case of order having insufficient funds in customer account.

        This API resets AuthorizationExpirationDate on each eligible order and raises the event for each. The event can be configured to call requestCollection immediately to process the maximum number of held orders.

        Note: This API can be called without passing any criteria. In that case API selects all the orders in the system and then filters by applying the conditions mentioned above. API will be more efficient if called for customer accounts that maintain limits and authorization within the system.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:None.

        Events Raised:
        This event is raised under base transaction TRIGGER_REQ_COLLECTION.

        ON_SUCCESS:

          This event is raised upon successful execution of the changeOrder API.
          Data published - YFS_TRIGGER_REQ_COLLECTION.ON_SUCCESS.xml
          Key data - modifyOrder_dbd.txt
          Template Support - Yes. Some of the elements and attributes are not template driven. Refer to the xml for element level details.

Audits: None

Pre-conditions: None

Post-conditions: None

Output Template Support: No

Database Extensibility Support: Yes

Parameters:
env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

Returns:
An xml document containing the details of the processed Order. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

Throws:
YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException
java.rmi.RemoteException
